title: Chris Hemsworth meets fans at Monash University
text:
He watched the UFC fight at Marvel Stadium with his wife Elsa Pataky on Sunday.

And on Monday, Chris Hemsworth opted for a change of pace when he met fans at Monash University in his home city of Melbourne.

The Thor: Ragnarok star, 36, posed with medical students outside the School of Public Health building.

Thor the people! After watching the UFC fight over the weekend, Chris Hemsworth opted for a change of pace when he met fans at Monash University in Melbourne on Monday (pictured)

Chris dressed casually in a loose-fitting charcoal sweater with a grey T-shirt and black jeans.

His hair was swept to the side while his signature stubbly beard was on display.

On the previous day, Chris and his wife Elsa, 43, had front row seats to the UFC bout at Marvel Stadium.

Anything for the fans! While attending the UFC event, Chris greeted several lucky fans, including a fellow audience member (left) who looked delighted by his photo op

'Kind of a big deal': The Hollywood star later went backstage to congratulate Australian featherweight fighter Megan Anderson (right) on her victory

While attending the event, Chris greeted several lucky fans, including a fellow audience member who looked delighted by his photo op.

The Hollywood star later went backstage to congratulate Australian featherweight fighter Megan Anderson on her victory.

'Guys... I met Thor at Marvel Stadium... kind of a big deal. Thanks Chris Hemsworth for taking the time for me after my UFC 243 win,' Megan later wrote on Instagram.

Touching down: Chris, who lives in Byron Bay, jetted into Melbourne on Sunday ahead of the UFC extravaganza. Pictured with a fan at Melbourne Airport

Chris and Elsa, who live in Byron Bay, jetted into Melbourne on Sunday ahead of the UFC extravaganza.

The Marvel Universe star recently told OK! Magazine that he's glad his family moved back to his Australia permenantly in 2014.

'Moving back to Australia was a very good decision for us,' he said.

'There I can be with people and talk about things that have nothing to do with the film business. That's almost impossible in Los Angeles, where there's rarely a moment when you can forget that you're an actor.'
description: He watched the UFC fight at Marvel Stadium with his wife Elsa Pataky on Sunday.
authors: Shive Prema For Daily Mail Australia
